text.section: Legal process shall be served upon a domestic reciprocal insurer by serving the insurer's attorney at his principal offices or by serving the Secretary of State as the insurer's process agent, as provided in KRS 304.3-230.

Any judgment based upon legal process so served shall be binding upon each of the insurer's subscribers as their respective interests may appear, but in an amount not exceeding their respective contingent liabilities, if any, the same as though personal service of process was had upon each subscriber.

law.history: Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 319, sec. 8, effective July 15, 1982. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 301, subtit. 27, sec. 13, effective June 18, 1970.
